result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandre D Hannon

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Deandre D Hannon appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Deandre D Hannon.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense is working with the State to obtain all discovery.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services 10-24-2022 Supervision Report

Defendant Deandre D Hannon appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Deandre D Hannon.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Arnold. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services 09-26-2022 Supervision Report
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services 09-26-2022 Supervision Report

Defendant Deandre D Hannon in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Deandre D Hannon appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Case is adjourned. Defense had a scheduling conflict. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deandre D Hannon in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

22RM030560  Actual Date Bond Posted with *  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFF
06/16/2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Deandre D Hannon in court with Student Intern Ryan Birschbach under the supervision of attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Deandre D Hannon in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deandre D Hannon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
